intro: Vandellia chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese vandellia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface and thrives in shaded, moist environments. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing along forest floors or in rocky crevices. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
